meanings.definition: A unit of linear measure equal to one twelfth of a foot.
meanings.sent1: She measured the table with an inch ruler.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter marked the wood every inch.
meanings.sent3: The inchworm inched along the branch, amusing the children.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to inch by as they waited for the results.
meanings.sent5: The inch of frosting on the cake made it extra delicious.

meanings.definition: To move slowly and carefully in a specified direction.
meanings.sent1: The snail would inch forward, little by little.
meanings.sent2: They had to inch their way through the narrow cave.
meanings.sent3: The turtle inched towards the finish line, causing laughter.
meanings.sent4: The line of ants seemed to inch along the sidewalk.
meanings.sent5: She had to inch the heavy box across the room.

meanings.sent1: He only had an inch of space left in his suitcase.
meanings.sent2: She took an inch of milk for her coffee.
meanings.sent3: The inch of rain was enough to make the roads slippery.
meanings.sent4: The inch of progress they made was encouraging.
meanings.sent5: An inch of effort can make a big difference in the end.
